description: From Italian canzonetta, from canzone (“song”) + -etta (“-ette: forming diminutives”), from Latin cantiō. Doublet of canzonetta. Cf. canzone.

entries.meaning: A short song, now especially one which is light and breezy.
examples: Besides what I have said of one of their warlike songs, I have another amorous canzonet, which beginneth in this sence […].
